qas.question: In what ways did the Eastern Catholic Churches's legal systems vary from those of the west?
What led to the Code of Canons of the Eastern Churches?
When was the law of the Eastern Catholic Churches promoted?
Who sponsored the promulgation of Eastern Catholic Church laws?
What was the name of the formal version of laws ruling the Eastern Catholic Churches?

answers.text: the Code of Canons of the Eastern Churches

qas.question: What did the Easter and Western Catholic church have in common?
When was the coded canons of the Western churches promulgated?
Who promulgated the code of canons for the Western churches?

plausible_answers.text: Code of Canons of the Eastern Churches

qas.question: What was the informal version of laws the Eastern Catholic churches?

context: The canon law of the Eastern Catholic Churches, which had developed some <a0_0>different <b5_0>disciplines and practices<b5_0/><a0_0/>, underwent its own <a1_0>process of codification<a1_0/>, resulting in <a4_0>the <b8_0>Code of Canons of the Eastern Churches<b8_0/><a4_0/> promulgated in <a2_0><b6_0>1990<b6_0/><a2_0/> by <a3_0><b7_0>Pope John Paul II<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
